Foundation Degree in Supporting Learning: Sport, Physical Education and Health (XC36)*

column2: Foundation Degree in Supporting Learning: Sport, Physical Education and Health (XC36)*

column1: Foundation Degree in Supporting Learning: Sport, Physical Education and Health (XC36)*
Email a friend information about this course

This specialist version of the Supporting Learning Foundation Degree is designed for those support workers who are already contributing or wish to develop the provision of high quality PE and/or PSHE in schools. In particular, you will learn how to promote positive attitudes and nurture enthusiasm, how to develop childrenÂs sporting skills and the benefits of an active lifestyle.

You will also be able to help the school gain ÂHealthy SchoolÂ status by learning about childrenÂs health beliefs and attitudes, and ways of empowering children to make healthy behaviour choices. A range of health issues will be covered,

eg. emotional health and bullying, healthy environments, keeping safe, drug education and staff well-being. However, a particular focus will be placed on healthy eating, drinking and physical activity. You will learn how extended school provision such as breakfast and cooking clubs, after school and holiday activity schemes can make childrenÂs lives happier, healthier, safer and more successful. You will take a selection of other more general modules such as Developing and Learning, Managing Behaviour and Promoting Inclusion.
The taught element is delivered on a part-time basis one afternoon/twilight session (1.30 Â 7.00pm) each term-time week (normally over 2 years).
The majority of your development and learning will take place in the workplace.

Successful completion of the programme leads to the award of Foundation Degree and the opportunity to progress to an honours degree within the Sport, Health, Leisure and Nutrition or Education departÂ­ments eg. BA Sport Development and PE, Childhood and Youth or Primary QTS. Students can choose to be assessed for Higher Level Teaching Assistant (HLTA) status during the second year.
